DS2 can not be cracked, at least for two or three months.
It uses the newest drm technology, 
so the bestway to play the game is to buy it, and give your money away, a pity!

I have a friend who is one of ea's anti-pirate researching team, he told me that 
even the best hacker will find it challenging to
crack this new drm...
Ubi's "latest DRM" didn't take 2-3 months to crack. Some EA hack's thoughts on their latest DRM doesn't interest me in the slightest.

The game is already cracked.  Scene groups just wait allowing publishers to make some money. I wish they would simply stop cracking pc games and force people to buy originals. 
Stop asking where is the crack  the longer we wait , more money the publishers will make , translating to more games for pc if there is a profit potential.

I have downloaded cracks or cracked versions of games I own because the DRM is either not compatible with newer computers, OR the DRM makes the game un-playable.

So I do not even consider buying a game until it can be cracked.  Only then will I consider buying a game.  Why?  Because I like to keep my games and play them again and again.  I have some games that are 15-20 years old that I STILL play!
so wherZ the HAWX2 crack then...if hasn't already been 2-3 months without crack............

DRM doesn't do shit to stop piracy, nor does it help to regionalize a game's release since the amount of piracy seems directly proportional to the High cost, and limited availability of games, as well as unsecured access to scene releases. Since i don't think TPB or for that matter any scene will be going any where anytime soon.... I'd say DRM doesn't offer much more than a backlash from the very consumers these companies are trying to do business with.

Doesn't seem to make any sense to me, especially when i could go and spend 60 bucks on black ops which is at least worth playing for its multiplayer.... screw 10 or even 21 hours of single player game time.... come on people that's just a way to procrastinate...
